intro: Analectis, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. They produce small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Analectis species are often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and they are adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
